definition: hair/drawing brush/(in the) least/one thousandth/currency unit, 0.1 yuan

sentences.english: And don't hesitate to dial 911 if you think you or another family member is in immediate danger.
sentences.chinese: 如果家中有人非常危险，请毫不迟疑地拨打911。

sentences.english: He accepted the job offer without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不迟疑的接受了这个工作。

sentences.english: No hesitation at all, just her wide smile.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不迟疑，她只是开怀大笑。

sentences.english: He did not hesitate to subtract terms with literal coefficients.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不迟疑地进行了文字系数项的相减。

sentences.english: Dogs readily take to training and can be easily housebroken .
sentences.chinese: 狗毫不迟疑地喜爱训练，而且喜欢在家捣乱。

sentences.english: These wishes the grief-stricken emperor readily promised to fulfill.
sentences.chinese: 悲痛欲绝的皇帝毫不迟疑地答应实现她的这些愿望。

sentences.english: I did not hesitate to make the admission.
We start on Task A2 without delay.
sentences.chinese: 我们毫不迟疑地开始进行任务A2。

sentences.english: This required tough decisions, but he did not hesitate to make them.
sentences.chinese: 这需要作出强硬决定，但他毫不迟疑地做到了。

sentences.english: Consumers have had no qualms about expressing their concerns.
sentences.chinese: 消费者毫不迟疑地表达出他们的担心。

definition: to act without taking time to think (idiom); to react instantly/to fire from the hip
see 不假思索[bu4 jia3 si1 suo3]
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
to follow your orders/to do as you bid
